cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 510 mi SSE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving slowly northwest, then north-northwest, targeting the middle-upper Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O’Connor / Matagorda Bay, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of San Luis Pass to High Island (includes Beaumont/Port Arthur area); Storm Surge Watch Port Mansfield to High Island; Hurricane Watch Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coast from Port Mansfield through High Island and into far SW Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible late Friday through Sunday with a peak 10 % chance of 34-kt sustained winds; low (≤4 %) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge inundation of 4–6 ft possible along the Upper Texas coast, including Sabine Pass and the Sabine-Neches waterway that services Beaumont.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches with isolated 20 inches possible, creating life-threatening freshwater flooding in the Beaumont area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, potential prolonged river/industrial canal flooding that could disrupt port operations.
